Package minesweeper

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • minesweeper.Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates the JFrame holding the Tile's and populates the JFrame with the tiles as well as creates the info frame and the 2D array used by Game_Driver to control the Minesweeper game eventually passing full control to Game_Driver.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private static javax.swing.JLabel mFlags
      JLabel that displays the text containing Flags Available and also the current number of mFlags which is equivalent to mNumFlags
      private static javax.swing.JFrame mGame
      JFrame that displays the Tile objects that correspond to the minesweeper board.
      private static javax.swing.JFrame mInfo
      JFrame that holds the replay JButton as well as the JLabel that tells the user how many mFlags are available to be placed still.
      private static int mNumFlags
      Number of mFlags available to the user which is equal to the number of mines on the board.
      (package private) static int tileSize
      Constant size of a square tile will be tileSize * tileSize, or 30x30 pixels

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Board​(int rowLength, int colLength, int mines)
      This constructor takes in the various input values from the user that is checked in the Menu object on start up and also in this constructor.

      Returns the JFrame mInfo that is created during initGame(int, int, int) that holds information about available mFlags and also allows the user to restart the mGame.

    • Field Detail

      • mFlags

        private static javax.swing.JLabel mFlags
        JLabel that displays the text containing Flags Available and also the current number of mFlags which is equivalent to mNumFlags

      • mGame

        private static javax.swing.JFrame mGame
        JFrame that displays the Tile objects that correspond to the minesweeper board. Reference to this object is passed to Game_Driver to allow Game_Driver to control the board.

      • mInfo

        private static javax.swing.JFrame mInfo
        JFrame that holds the replay JButton as well as the JLabel that tells the user how many mFlags are available to be placed still. Useful as member variable to let other functions manipulate text field indicating available mines.
        See Also:
        getInfoFrame()

      • mNumFlags

        private static int mNumFlags
        Number of mFlags available to the user which is equal to the number of mines on the board. Used by various functions to track mFlags placed by user.
        See Also:
        incrementFlagCount(), decrementFlagCount(), getFlagCount()

      • tileSize

        static final int tileSize
        Constant size of a square tile will be tileSize * tileSize, or 30x30 pixels
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        Board​(int rowLength,
      int colLength,
      int mines)
        This constructor takes in the various input values from the user that is checked in the Menu object on start up and also in this constructor. Once preconditions are checked and verified, initGame() is added to the EventQueue.
        Parameters:
        rowLength - An integer representing the length of a row
        colLength - An integer representing the length of a column
        mines - An integer representing the number of mines in a mGame
        Pre-condition:
        Input fields from Menu have been verified and the user has pressed the "Start" button
        Post-condition:
        initGame() is successfully added to the EventQueue once inputs are verified once more

    • Method Detail

      • decrementFlagCount

        static void decrementFlagCount()
        Takes the information stored in the mFlags JLabel and decrements it and updates the Label
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - If thrown the JLabel holding the display value for the number of mFlags remaining for some reason does not parse into an integer correctly.
        See Also:
        incrementFlagCount()
        Pre-condition:
        The user has flagged a tile and the JLabel holding flag information must be decremented
        Post-condition:
        The JLabel holding the flag information is displayed with a value 1 less than calling

      • getFlagCount

        static int getFlagCount()
        Returns the member variable mNumFlags that corresponds to the number of mFlags in the current mGame of minesweeper.
        Returns:
        mNumFlags Number of mFlags available to be placed
        See Also:
        mNumFlags
        Pre-condition:
        No gaurantees are made before this function is called
        Post-condition:
        The integer stored in mNumFlags is returned

      • getInfoFrame

        static javax.swing.JFrame getInfoFrame()
        Returns the JFrame mInfo that is created during initGame(int, int, int) that holds information about available mFlags and also allows the user to restart the mGame.
        Returns:
        mInfo JFrame that holds the replay button and the flag JLabel.
        See Also:
        mInfo
        Pre-condition:
        No gaurantees are made before this function is called
        Post-condition:
        The JFrame object called mInfo is returned

      • incrementFlagCount

        static void incrementFlagCount()
        Takes the information stored in the mFlags JLabel and increments it and updates the Label
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - If thrown the JLabel holding the display value for the number of mFlags remaining for some reason does not parse into an integer correctly.
        See Also:
        decrementFlagCount()
        Pre-condition:
        The user has unflagged a tile and the JLabel holding flag information must be incremented
        Post-condition:
        The JLabel holding the flag information is displayed with a value 1 greater than calling

      • initGame

        private void initGame​(int numCols,
                      int numRows,
                      int mines)
        Called only by the constructor of Board(int, int, int) after appropriate preconditions are checked. Creates the JFrame object that displays the Tile and generates the 2D array that stores the Tiles for use by the Game_Driver class in controlling the minesweeper mGame.
        Parameters:
        numCols - Number of columns which is related to the length of a row
        numRows - Number of rows which is related to the length of a column
        mines - Number of mines in the board
        Pre-condition:
        Input parameters are verified by constructor and board is ready to be generated from information
        Post-condition:
        A JFrame object holding the desired Tiles and a 2D array corresponding to the board are passed to a Game_Driver object with the parameters that will take user input and respond accordingly to play a minesweeper mGame.

      • main

        public static void main()
        Main function of Board.java holds no particular significance and is left blank.
        Pre-condition:
        No gaurantees are made before this function is called
        Post-condition:
        No result of calling Board.main()

      • verifyBoardParam

        private void verifyBoardParam​(int col,
                              int row,
                              int mines)
        Checks the passed in parameters to ensure that they meet the requirements.
        Parameters:
        col - the number of columns must be 2 or greater, otherwise throw an exception
        row - the number of rows must be 2 or greater, otherwise throw an exception
        mines - the number of mines must be greater than 0 but less than the number of tiles (row * col)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Exception thrown if any of the past in arguments do not pass the specified requirements.
        Pre-condition:
        Board values are needing to be verified.
        Post-condition:
        Passed in board values were verified and no exception was thrown
